title: "What is Missing?"
description: |
  The Florida Department of Corrections collects a significant amount of data for its administrative purposes. While I am unsure of the exact details as they have denied all of my FOIA requests, it is clear that they gather a substantial amount of information. This list, although not comprehensive or accurate, is presented to aid in brainstorming for those who could potentially have access to any of this data or resources to support my acquiring and analysis of it. It highlights some of the data that I suspect they may be holding and emphasizes the potential value that public access to this data could bring.

This data would allow incarcerated persons to hold staff members accountable for their actions and to advocate for more effective disciplinary policies.</li></ul><ul id="f49c060f-f6b8-4fb0-bee7-112727c1b342" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:disc">Access to data on the number and types of educational and vocational programs offered to incarcerated persons, as well as the qualifications of the instructors and staff who oversee those programs. This data would allow incarcerated persons to make informed decisions about their education and career paths, and to advocate for more diverse and effective educational programs.</li></ul><ul id="a8c33189-0595-4836-9cb5-ca1e85f8ca89" class="bulleted-list"><li style="list-style-type:disc">Access to data on the number and types of medical and mental health services available to incarcerated persons, as well as the qualifications and experience of the medical and mental health staff.
